content:
• Wednesday, July 18, 2012
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) has resumed trading after posting a huge Q2 beat. Shares are up 54.5% AH,...

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) has resumed trading after posting a huge Q2 beat. Shares are up 54.5% AH, easily blowing past their all-time high. Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) owns a 9.8% stake in Mellanox - its value just increased by about $141M. Mellanox's beat is also good news for Oracle to the extent it reflects well on sales of Oracle's high-end Exadata and Exalogic systems, which contain Mellanox's InfiniBand adapters.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) +2.2% AH after Bill Ackman defends his investment in the retailer at...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) +2.2% AH after Bill Ackman defends his investment in the retailer at CNBC's Alpha conference. Ackman predicts he can make a 10x-15x return on JCP, and declares its selloff to be the result of PR rather than fundamentals.  (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    Wireless chipmakers are moving higher after Qualcomm and Skyworks post earnings and guidance...

    Wireless chipmakers are moving higher after Qualcomm and Skyworks post earnings and guidance that were better than many expected, given widespread reports of slowing smartphone growth and component order cuts. TQNT +3.5%. RFMD +2.6%. CRUS +1.6%. OVTI +1.5%. INVN +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • NE

    Noble (NYSE:NE): Q2 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $899M (+43% Y/Y) beats by $4M....

    Noble (NYSE:NE): Q2 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $899M (+43% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • FFIV

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): Reports an in-line FQ3 on all fronts with a 16% jump in Y/Y...

    More on F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): Reports an in-line FQ3 on all fronts with a 16% jump in Y/Y net profits, but the stock is lower in post-session trading after the company guides its FQ4 below Street expectations. Blaming a cautious spending environment, it now expects to earn between $1.16 - $1.19 per share, below current Q4 EPS estimates of $1.24. Shares -3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $389M (+9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $389M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Expects FQ4 revenue of $415M-$420M and EPS of $0.50-$0.51 vs. consensus of $418.2M and $0.51. Shares +9.6% AH due to lowered expectations. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) announces plans to sell 8.1M shares of common stock. Wells...

    Diana Containerships (NASDAQ:DCIX) announces plans to sell 8.1M shares of common stock. Wells Fargo Securities, BofA Merrill Lynch and UBS are acting as joint-book runners of the offering. Barclays and RBC Capital Markets will act as co-managers. Shares -13.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ1 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $582.8M (-5.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ1 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $582.8M (-5.3% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares -1.6% AH (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • SYK

    Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q2 EPS of $0.998 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.1B (+2.9% Y/Y) in-line....

    Stryker (NYSE:SYK): Q2 EPS of $0.998 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $2.1B (+2.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • EBAY

    More on eBay's (NASDAQ:EBAY) Q2: Marketplaces business organic growth rate up 15% Y/Y, excluding...

    More on eBay's (NASDAQ:EBAY) Q2: Marketplaces business organic growth rate up 15% Y/Y, excluding effect of foreign exchange. PayPal saw revenue increase 26% Y/Y and active registered accounts rise 13% to 113.2M. Merchant Services revenue 23% higher Y/Y to $23.1M. Expects Q3 net revenue of $3.30B-$3.40B and full-year net revenue of $13.80B-$14.10B, largely in-line with analyst estimates. Shares +4.1% AH. Earnings conference call upcoming (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) announces plans to sell an undisclosed amount of common stock...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) announces plans to sell an undisclosed amount of common stock to be used for general corporate purposes. Piper Jaffray and Leerink Swann will acting as joint book-running managers in the offering. Shares -9.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $205.5M (+27.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q2 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $205.5M (+27.2% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +14.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ3 EPS of $1.14 in-line. Revenue of $352.6M (+21.3% Y/Y) in-line....

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ3 EPS of $1.14 in-line. Revenue of $352.6M (+21.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (MOH +4.1%) finishes the day higher after announcing earlier that the Centers...

    Molina Healthcare (MOH +4.1%) finishes the day higher after announcing earlier that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services has given the go ahead to implement its Medicaid Management Information System in Idaho. The system underwent stringent monitoring for a week, followed by further evaluation by the agency to successfully receive the certification.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • CHKP

    In spite of posting a mixed Q2 report, Check Point (CHKP +6.9%) closed with big gains. A new $1B...

    In spite of posting a mixed Q2 report, Check Point (CHKP +6.9%) closed with big gains. A new $1B stock buyback (good for buying 10% of outstanding shares) helped, as did in-line Q3 guidance (revenue of $316M-$345M and EPS of $0.74-$0.81 vs. consensus of $339.9M and $0.79) that soothed concerns about heavy Euro dependence (39% of sales). Security hardware peers also rallied on a very good day for enterprise tech. FTNT +10.4%. FIRE +6.4%. JNPR +6.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • AIRM

    Medical transportation firm Air Methods (AIRM +9.6%) ranks among the day's top movers after...

    Medical transportation firm Air Methods (AIRM +9.6%) ranks among the day's top movers after projecting strong Q2 earnings, citing growth in same-base transports, improved reimbursement for community-based transports, and lower maintenance expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • ARLP

    BB&T's Mark Levin is still bullish on one coal producer, rating Alliance Resource Partners...

    BB&T's Mark Levin is still bullish on one coal producer, rating Alliance Resource Partners (ARLP +1.7%) a Buy partly because its MLP structure pays out consistent dividends while investors wait for the thermal coal market to recover. He's not sure when that uptick will come, but sometimes market perception recovers more quickly than physical markets, he says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • FDO

    Family Dollar (FDO -2.1%) trades lower after hosting an investor meeting this afternoon....

    Family Dollar (FDO -2.1%) trades lower after hosting an investor meeting this afternoon. Highlights: A forecast of 5%-7% annual sales growth. Growth remains a focus, with 27 stores opened YTD in California. Says its digital business is only a "small piece" of the overall pie at the moment. (presentation slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • NTR

    Agrium (AGU +3.6%) maintains its strength from this morning's 15% hike in its Q2 earnings...

    Agrium (AGU +3.6%) maintains its strength from this morning's 15% hike in its Q2 earnings guidance due to strong results across its crop-input business. Lazard lifts its price target on the shares to $105 from $94, seeing strengthening AGU fundamentals, but Citi remains Neutral on the stock, preferring Potash (POT +0.6%) among fertilizer makers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • NBR

    Barclays lowers its earnings estimates and stock price target on Nabors (NBR +1.9%) "to reflect...

    Barclays lowers its earnings estimates and stock price target on Nabors (NBR +1.9%) "to reflect the unfolding pressure on land rig dayrates and utilization faced by the land drillers, continued deterioration in the stimulation market, and the increased potential that the rig count will trend down modestly in 2H12." Yesterday, NBR warned on Q2 profits based on weak pressure pumping results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • BAC

    A nice in move higher in the broad averages leaves the big banks behind. Hit particularly hard...

    A nice in move higher in the broad averages leaves the big banks behind. Hit particularly hard is Bank of America (BAC -4.4%), which delivered a nice headline number, but the particulars of its underlying business (and future liabilities) leave less to be excited about. Reporting tomorrow is Morgan Stanley (MS -2.7%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMT

    American Tower (AMT -4.5%) is diving on a downgrade to Neutral from Citi. The firm cites a high...

    American Tower (AMT -4.5%) is diving on a downgrade to Neutral from Citi. The firm cites a high valuation following a strong run-up over the last 12 months, and a lack of "meaningful upside" to Street estimates. Other wireless tower owners are lower in sympathy. SBAC -2%. CCI -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • NXPI

    On a strong day for chip stocks, NXP (NXPI +8.1%) is among the best performers after announcing...

    On a strong day for chip stocks, NXP (NXPI +8.1%) is among the best performers after announcing an audio subsystem chip for mobile devices it boasts will increase the output power of phone speakers by 5x. The chip, which relies on technology that prevents the thermal damage that would normally occur at such power levels, competes with solutions from Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) and others. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDXG

    PDI (PDII +1.3%) says one of its clients has received FDA approval to market its product. PDII...

    PDI (PDII +1.3%) says one of its clients has received FDA approval to market its product. PDII will provide an array of promotional services for its rollout, including a dedicated sales team, plus teledetailing and digital communications services. The contract is expected to generate total revenue of approximately $57M over the life of the two-year agreement, with $10M-$11M to be recorded over the second half of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • FDX

    Shares of FedEx (FDX +1.5%) and UPS (UPS +1.3%) outperform broad market indexes with talk about...

    Shares of FedEx (FDX +1.5%) and UPS (UPS +1.3%) outperform broad market indexes with talk about the $1B contract with the U.S. Postal Service that is in play serving as a major backdrop on the stocks. The consensus from analysts is that FedEx is the overwhelming favorite to retain the contract, but the threat of a disruption to its revenue model will remain an overhang until the matter is settled.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • INTC

    Chip stocks are staging a big rally (SOXX +3.5%) thanks to Intel's (INTC +3.7%)...

    Chip stocks are staging a big rally (SOXX +3.5%) thanks to Intel's (INTC +3.7%) better-than-feared Q2 report and guidance. Deutsche and Credit Suisse think Intel is setting the bar low for 2H12, and UBS expects rising server CPU and ultrabook sales to keep margins healthy. However, other firms express worries about macro conditions, a strong dollar, and slowing emerging markets growth. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY +6.7%) jumps after BofA starts coverage with a Buy and $40 PT. The firm thinks...

    Shutterfly (SFLY +6.7%) jumps after BofA starts coverage with a Buy and $40 PT. The firm thinks Shutterfly's valuation has been compressed by pricing worries, and argues the restructuring of HP's Snapfish unit, along with the additional scale provided by Shutterfly's acquisitions, will improve its pricing environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • FOLD

    Amicus Theraputics' (FOLD +13%) expansion of its deal with GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1.3%) is a...

    Amicus Theraputics' (FOLD +13%) expansion of its deal with GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +1.3%) is a positive, according to ThinkEquity. It validates FOLD's technology, the firm says, and grants it several important concessions, including full U.S. rights in Fabry and $18.6M in cash. The firm reiterates its $9 target and Buy rating on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education (EDU -19.1%) slumps again after Goldman Sachs suspends its rating due to...

    New Oriental Education (EDU -19.1%) slumps again after Goldman Sachs suspends its rating due to a previously announced SEC investigation and Muddy Waters sets its short-selling sights on the financials of the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    A bevy of Street analysts weigh in on Vivus' (VVUS +11%): Cowen says Qsymia has "considerably...

    A bevy of Street analysts weigh in on Vivus' (VVUS +11%): Cowen says Qsymia has "considerably better" efficacy over Arena's (ARNA -7.5%) Belviq. Brean Murray says the approval came clean, without any harsh restrictions. Jefferies - after initially being negative on the stock - calls the FDA decision a "major win" for the company and upgrades the shares to Underperform. Wells Fargo is a bit more cautious, saying that despite the big win, the company still faces reimbursement challenges, a restrictive distribution network, and patient compliance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 18 Comments
  • OBE

    Penn West Energy (PWE -4.2%) suffers two downgrades from analysts at RBC Capital and Barclays....

    Penn West Energy (PWE -4.2%) suffers two downgrades from analysts at RBC Capital and Barclays. RBC cuts shares to Sector Perform, saying it wants to wait for clarity on what steps PWE plans to take to reduce its debt levels over the next year though asset sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • DLB

    Dolby (DLB -1.4%) slumps after receiving a downgrade to Underweight from JPMorgan's Paul Coster,...

    Dolby (DLB -1.4%) slumps after receiving a downgrade to Underweight from JPMorgan's Paul Coster, who thinks business will be ugly through 2013. Coster notes sales are weak for PCs, TVs, and other consumer electronics products Dolby collects royalties on, with smartphones the only major exception. Eric Savitz notes the downgrade follows warnings from Rovi and DTS, who also license their technology to electronics OEMs. Goldman is also bearish on Dolby.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -6.8%) shares are downgraded to Hold at Stifel Nicolaus on the stock having...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -6.8%) shares are downgraded to Hold at Stifel Nicolaus on the stock having approached the firm's target price and with a limited near-term upside from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • JCP

    More on JCP: The company lands a high-profile fashion designer with the announcement that Nina...

    More on JCP: The company lands a high-profile fashion designer with the announcement that Nina Garcia will be a partner. The development could be behind the mini-rally in shares, JCP up 1.4%, although Ron Johnson delivered a bit of a buzzkill to investors with his warning that the company planned to go backwards and will "go backwards a little more" in comments made at a tech conference. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • ATHN

    athenahealth (ATHN +7.6%) moves up today after winning a deal to replace Quality Systems (QSII...

    athenahealth (ATHN +7.6%) moves up today after winning a deal to replace Quality Systems (QSII -8.1%) as Health Management Associates' (HMA -0.8%) business service provider. Under the deal, ATHN will facilitate more than 1,200 medical groups currently being serviced by QSII. Wells Fargo likes the deal, saying it will significantly improve 'doc add'' numbers for ATHN in the first half of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy (SN -3.7%) shares slide after the company provides an Eagle Ford Shale operations...

    Sanchez Energy (SN -3.7%) shares slide after the company provides an Eagle Ford Shale operations update. Proved reserves rose 125% to 15M boe at June 30, up from 6.7M at Dec. 31. SN reaffirms its 2012 production exit rate guidance range of 4K-5K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • ERIC

    Ericsson (ERIC +4.5%), which has been in a depressed trading range due to worries about a tepid...

    Ericsson (ERIC +4.5%), which has been in a depressed trading range due to worries about a tepid mobile capex environment, is bouncing after delivering a Q2 beat: a 26% Y/Y increase in Global Services revenue offset a 17% drop in network equipment sales, though at the cost of a 580 bps drop in gross margin. The report, which backs up Ericsson's market share boasts, contrasts sharply with the warnings delivered by rivals Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -0.5%) and ZTE.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SOMX

    Somaxon (SOMX +83%) soars this morning - after initially surging over 150% in pre-open trading -...

    Somaxon (SOMX +83%) soars this morning - after initially surging over 150% in pre-open trading - on the back of yesterday's announcement of its litigation settlement over Silenor with Mylan (MYL +0.8%) and Par Pharmaceuticals. The company added that it sees higher Q2 net sales for Silenor, now seeing revenue of approximately $2.8M to $2.9M, up from reported sales of $2.7M in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +2.1%) announces a new discovery off the coast of Ghana in Africa in...

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +2.1%) announces a new discovery off the coast of Ghana in Africa in 1,926 ft. of water. The Wawa-1 exploration well hit 43 net ft. of oil and 65 ft. of gas condensate. The discovery "extends the presence of hydrocarbon-bearing formations more than six miles to the north of the Enyenra-3A well," the company says. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical's (MAKO -4.2%) Senior VP of Sales & Marketing, Steven Nunes, left the company...

    Mako Surgical's (MAKO -4.2%) Senior VP of Sales & Marketing, Steven Nunes, left the company yesterday, with CEO Maurice Ferre assuming sales responsibilities until the firm finds a VP of Sales. Nunes departure comes after Mako's shares were battered last week following a sales warning. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 6 Comments
  • YPF

    Argentina's recently nationalized oil and gas company YPF (YPF +2.6%) will pay out just 5.7% of...

    Argentina's recently nationalized oil and gas company YPF (YPF +2.6%) will pay out just 5.7% of 2011's profits as dividends, in contrast with recent years when payouts surpassed 80%. YPF plans to invest ~$7B/year during 2013-17 in an ambitious plan to boost declining output.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • MBOT

    Shares of StemCells (STEM -19.4%) give back some of yesterday's +100% move on a spate of...

    Shares of StemCells (STEM -19.4%) give back some of yesterday's +100% move on a spate of profit-taking this morning. Yesterday, the stock rocketed higher after the  company announced positive results from its Alzheimer's preclinical trials, which showed memory restoration and enhanced synaptic function after transplanting human neural stem cells into animal models.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • MD

    Shares of health care provider Mednax (MD -6.3%) take a hit today after Deutsche cut the stock...

    Shares of health care provider Mednax (MD -6.3%) take a hit today after Deutsche cut the stock to sell and dropped its price target to $58 from $73. The firm notes that [[MD] specializes in intensive care for critically ill pregnant women and newborns, and could face headwinds from initiatives to reduce pre-term births. Certain programs are already having an impact on neonatal intensive care unit utilization, and Deutsche says the company's volumes are "likely to be stunted in the face of these challenges."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • ROVI

    Investors show no mercy to Rovi (ROVI -40.6%) over its huge Q2/2012 warning, which had much to...

    Investors show no mercy to Rovi (ROVI -40.6%) over its huge Q2/2012 warning, which had much to do with delayed patent licenses. Shares are now at levels last seen in 2008. Cowen and Barrington have downgraded shares to Neutral in response. Brean Murray is reiterating a Buy on a belief shares are oversold, but has cut its PT nearly in half, and claims Rovi "has been a slow moving train wreck" ever since its acquisition of Sonic Solutions, which closed early last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BAMM

    Shares of Books-A-Million (BAMM -19.2%) sink after Chairman Clyde Anderson and his family end...

    Shares of Books-A-Million (BAMM -19.2%) sink after Chairman Clyde Anderson and his family end their bid to buy out the company. The proposed deal spurred seven separate lawsuits against the Anderson family. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • NGD

    New Gold (NGD +1.8%) says it continues to grow its Blackwater project's gold resource base, with...

    New Gold (NGD +1.8%) says it continues to grow its Blackwater project's gold resource base, with a 30% increase (1.7M oz.) in indicated resources. The new resource update incorporates more than four additional months of drill hole data added to the project's previous estimate from March.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) spike 4.8% higher after reports circulate tipping off...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) spike 4.8% higher after reports circulate tipping off that execs with the company are in the process of presenting to potential acquirers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +5.5%) jumps to $16.41 after pricing a previously-announced 8.5M share stock...

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +5.5%) jumps to $16.41 after pricing a previously-announced 8.5M share stock offering at $15.40. 2.35M shares will be issued by the company, presumably to help finance its acquisition of PowerReviews, and 6.15M will be sold by insiders. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • OSK

    Shares of a number of auto suppliers move higher with sector upgrades tipping sentiment. A...

    Shares of a number of auto suppliers move higher with sector upgrades tipping sentiment. A rating boost by Jefferies on Oshkosh Truck (OSK +5.1%) to Buy from Hold and JPMorgan's initiation of TRW Automotive (TRW +3.7%) at Overweight leads the charge. A common theme with analysts is that improvement in commercial and construction markets will help offset defense-industry sluggishness. Sector gainers: BWA +2.5%, NAV +1.9%, FSYS +3.2%, FDML +2.6%, SMP +2.5%, GNTX +2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +6.9%) receives a 15-year U.S. patent for a method to clear mucus in people...

    Discovery Labs (DSCO +6.9%) receives a 15-year U.S. patent for a method to clear mucus in people with pulmonary conditions such as cystic fibrosis, bronchiectasis and sinusitis. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • ITRI

    Itron (ITRI +3%) is awarded a contract by Turkey’s largest private gas utility, AKSA, to...

    Itron (ITRI +3%) is awarded a contract by Turkey’s largest private gas utility, AKSA, to provide 745K residential as well as commercial and industrial gas meters. Financial terms of the three-year deal, which will see ITRI's gas meters rolled out in 20 different regions of AKSA’s territory, are not revealed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • TSLA

    Maxim defends Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.5%) after it comes under attack from Wunderlich, saying...

    Maxim defends Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.5%) after it comes under attack from Wunderlich, saying channel checks indicate a rise in Model S reservations - a data point it considers more important than production delays. The back-and-forth banter on Tesla could continue for a while as the automaker just now starts to tiptoe into mainstream markets and hard numbers are still a ways off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • NTAP

    VMware and EMC's preliminary results (I, II) continue to fuel a rally among enterprise tech...

    VMware and EMC's preliminary results (I, II) continue to fuel a rally among enterprise tech names, many of which had been beaten down due to concerns about slumping IT spending, particularly in Europe. Some big winners: NTAP +4.7%. CTXS +4.5%. RVBD +5.1%. ARUN +7.8%. FTNT +5%. CRM +4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • RDS.A

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -0.2%) is in talks with Anadarko (APC +2%) about a potential bid for...

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -0.2%) is in talks with Anadarko (APC +2%) about a potential bid for APC's gas assets in Mozambique, Bloomberg reports. Shell began informal talks with APC about a deal for some or all of its 36.5% stake in the Rovuma-1 offshore gas fields, but APC is said to be reluctant to sell before further results of exploration in the area are known.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +10.4%) and EMC (EMC +9.3%) continue rallying after delivering Q2 results early (I,...

    VMware (VMW +10.4%) and EMC (EMC +9.3%) continue rallying after delivering Q2 results early (I, II), to go with news of their management shuffle. ThinkEquity sees the shakeup as evidence of VMware's pivotal role in shaping EMC's future. GigaOm's Derrick Harris notes new VMware CEO Pat Gelsinger appears more focused on nuts-and-bolts cloud infrastructure solutions than departing chief Paul Maritz, whose interest in applications led some to think VMware had lost touch with its roots.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • BAC

    BofA (NYSE:BAC) conference call: One motif is the confusion of analysts who can't seem to...

    BofA (NYSE:BAC) conference call: One motif is the confusion of analysts who can't seem to decipher the bank's earnings. CFO Bruce Thompson blames the decline in both consumer and business loans to runoff in real estate. Total headcount is off 4% Y/Y, but down 8% if new hires in delinquent mortgage servicing are backed out. The company confirms it is being questioned by regulators over Libor. Shares -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • SBUX
